Title: Motherhood
Content:
MOTHERHOOD
Motherhood is a challenge, single motherhood is even more so.Â  
I absolutely love being a mother, I wouldnâ€™t trade it for anything.Â  My three children mean everything to me, although there are those times that I wish I could take a break â€“ have a night to myself, sit in the hot tub alone, or even curl up in a Starbucks on one of their big fluffy chairs with a good book for a few hours.Â  But, since I am a complete full time stay-at-home single mom, 24Ã—7, this is not possible.Â  Itâ€™s exhausting, while at the same time it is everything to me.Â  They are my joy and my world.Â  I even think so when I am a jungle gym, or accomplishing the feat of feeding one baby with a bottle, nursing my near 2yo who likes to switch regularly "more, please" she says, and typing a paper Iâ€™m working on with my remaining hand.
I feel as though my parenting abilities are getting so much better.Â  When my voice attempts to be firm out of frustration, I have remembered to take a breath and talk quietly without the frustration, explaining the situation to them and why I need it to be a certain way.Â  Today I was full of praise, even though things werenâ€™t going too well.
I get down on their level so much more, act more child like.Â  Not childish, but child like.Â  I have seen such a difference in the kids since allowing myself to step out of the adult-no nonesense roll, and allow the child in me to come out.Â  
I picked up an easy bake oven for Alyssa last night, which she LOVED.Â  But the thrill of cooking quickly moved over to the kitchen.Â  This morning when I came out of the bedroom, a lovely mess was left for me to clean up.Â  She baked the most thoughtful cookie, consisting of soy sauce and an interesting mixture of herbs from my cooking cabinet.Â  That wasnâ€™t quite a problem, but what I was frustrated over was the disaster of a mess that was left.Â  She worked on cleaning up the kitchen while I cleaned the livingroomâ€¦. but then said she had the "itches" and couldnâ€™t do it anymore.Â  So we swapped.Â  I did what I could to praise her along the way, what a wonderful job she was doing clean, how well she did one item or another.Â  This seemed to give her a lot of drive for striving for more.
My praises to both girls is growing.Â  I smother Katherine with verbal and physical loves, and have stalled on doing the same for Alyssa because sheâ€™s so much bigger I think.Â  I have worked on changing that, continuing to tellÂ Alyssa, almost 7yo,Â how beautiful she is, what a wonderful daughter she is, how lucky I am to have her as my daughter, how smart she is, and what an amazing sister she is.Â  I let the praises flow out.Â  Katherine, out of no where Iâ€™ll say, "Katherine!"Â  "What?"Â  "I LOVE YOU!"Â  "Thaaank you!" from her sweet not yet 2yo mouth.Â  She now says "I love you" back, for not reason, and plasters me with a hugÂ ğŸ™‚
Tonight I took both girls to McDâ€™s for a treat.Â  After we came home and they finished eating, I rolled around with them on the floor being silly.Â  Alyssa said that it was the "best day", aww!
I think as parents we can always strive to do better.Â  I feel as though Iâ€™m a great mom, but I could certainly be so much higher quality one, which I continue to work towards.
HOMESCHOOLING
I made the final decision to homeschool my son this year, he would be entering 4th grade (recap of last year, he basically for what itâ€™s worth, failed 3rd grade).Â  Once that decision was made though, fear set in.Â  Will I be able to do this?Â  Am I going to fail him?Â  Is this the right choice?Â  I have no doubt it is, but O-M-G.Â  He is still down visiting his dad in Oregon, I pick him up this Saturday.Â  He is going to be so excited!â€¦ although he says that my description of what homeschool is going to be like for him sounds worse then school itself ğŸ˜›Â  Bet your backside!Â  No slacking with me! *crack whip* LOLÂ  Unfortunately his dad firmly disagrees with homeschooling.Â  I have gone back and forth with the choice of telling him ahead of time, regarding the plans Jonah and I have decided on, or waiting for the first series of WASL tests and other testing items he will have completed, and then showing his dad the results from last year vs this year.Â  I am leaning to the second option.Â  He will handle the news better when he sees the results of his sons learning having improving, not stalling as he believes would happen (saying that I am not a licensed teacher), as well as the strong social aspects he will be involved with.
I called the homeschool coordinator in this area and will be receiving the papers I need to sign shortly.Â  I need to talk with the public school to see what programs he can be involved with.Â  Iâ€™d love for him to be part of the before school chest club.Â  He wants to remain in art class.Â  I am going to check more into home school groups in this area.Â  There is the school I taught at last year, but Iâ€™m looking more for actual groups where the kids can play and parents can each work with the kids that matches an ability that they have, a few times a week.
I will be signing him up for:

Piano (Starting in November, private)
Swimming (Starting in April, semi private)
CookingÂ & Sewing (already set, 1 on 1)
Foreign Language (in addition to ASL, group)
House Paining (****)
Computer (learning to build one from the bottom up, group)
Art (Checking into the school system for this, group)
Chess or Go (group)
Baseball or Soccer (some sort of sport, group)

***A guy friend of mine is co-owners of a local painting company, and Iâ€™ve cleared with him already that when heâ€™s in the area and things slow down, Jonah will be able to spend a few days experiencing the painting field.Â  Heâ€™s a very hard worker.Â  He can work this into research and a report also.Â  
The base program I am using in the Robinson Curriculum, with Saxon Math.Â  I wont be following it to the T, since they say no TV as well asÂ it being aÂ bible curriculum.Â  Itâ€™s been the very best program I have found, and have been prepared with it for the last three years.
Ok, I admit it, Iâ€™m nervous.Â  LOL
Katherine was spouting off names of colors tonight.
Â  I love working with her.Â  I really think she too will flourish as a homeschooled child, but weâ€™ll see when the time comes around.Â  In the meantime Iâ€™ll continue working with her.Â  Alyssa though, craves the public school atmosphere and so far is flourishing there ğŸ™‚Â  She is SOOOO excited for school to start!Â  Sheâ€™ll be in FIRST GRADE!Â  OMGgoodness.
FRIENDS â€“ Dont conviently forget about a date with a friend, just because you have a date with a girl = potential girlfriend.Â  When it happens multiple times, it starts to hurt.
Today, I suddenly got a lump in my throat.Â  I felt hurt and upset and couldnâ€™t figure out why.Â  I mentioned it to a friend of mine, Jen,Â a while later and she says, "Itâ€™s not from me!!Â  Ask David!"Â  Oh the joys of picking emotions up from other people.Â  David certainly does this too, when Jen started labor a migraine hit him and intensified as her labor progressed.Â  I spent the evening with him until I headed over to her house at 1am, and he was absolutely miserable.Â  He certainly was pleased when it was all over, LOLÂ  Anyway, turns out that he is going out on a date Friday.Â  I am thrilled for him, but what about our plans?Â  Itâ€™s not the first time a date took presidence over a â€˜dateâ€™ weâ€™ve set, but today was the first time I said anything.Â  My feelings were most certainly hurt.Â  The lump in my throat?Â  Seems to have occured at the time when the date was set.Â  Atleast I figured out where it came from.Â  He attempted to reschedule, F that.Â  I am so done with taking second to potential girlfriends, when we have something already planned.Â  I had set up childcare, itâ€™s a rarity for me to step outside of my door without little feet right behind me.Â  I was looking forward to adult interaction without children in tow also, and he is someone I rarely get together with but enjoy my time around.Â

Friday is movie night!Â  JC called today and said sheâ€™s pretty sure sheâ€™ll be able to make it.Â  Whoo hooo!!!Â  I canâ€™t wait to see her again.Â  I am still seriously consid
ering taking Katherine with me, sheâ€™ll love all the dancing.Â  That girl can really get into moving!Â  If I ever figure out how to post a video here, Iâ€™ll do so.Â  Itâ€™s absolutely adorable.Â  Her eyes get to twinkling and she starts wiggling, haha.Â  Today she and I were skipping, twirling and dancing, back to our apartment from the mailbox.Â  I am such a dork, lol.Â

I hope I can update this soon, giving each girl a recent picture of their very own â€“ just them with their dad.Â  I asked Alyssa yesterday, what type of things she use to do over at Daddyâ€™s.Â  She sat thinking for a bit, and said she couldnâ€™t really remember (has it really been that long? â€“ six weeks) but said that she remembers going to Chucky Cheese alot.Â  HOW SWEET!!Â  Those are memories that kids carry forever.
I remember as a child, "special time" with my mom.Â  She was going to nursing school full time and working what seemed to be the rest of the time.Â  I rarely saw her, but she made it a strong point to always have a "special time" date set that she refused to miss.Â  Tuesday was my day.Â  She would pick me up from preschool and take me to a special place.Â  One time we went to a shoe repair store, and I was able to see how that was done.Â  I still remember the machines and the old man, as well as the shoe sole he has set upÂ for me to attempt to sew ğŸ™‚Â  Another time to the fire station, I saw a donald duck wheel movie on how to escape a burning house.Â  To feed the ducks.Â  Play on the playground.Â  Visit the book store, sit down for an ice cream cone, visit the sweet store, experience large birds, play dress up, etc.Â  Goodness, I must have been 4yo or nearing 5yo.Â  I was a youngster, but these times really made an impression on me.Â  These events are what enable me to know what is important for my own children.Â  And in turn theyâ€™ll repeat those events with their own children, and it passes through generations.Â  
I pray, and wish upon that stars outside, that eventually he finds the time to start spending more time with his girls.Â  To come over for a swim, go on a walk with them, to bring his car over so they can help him wash it, ride bikes together, take them for ice cream, to the movies, to the skating ring, anywhere.Â  Just time.Â  Even if he doesnâ€™t have the time to have them over for a whole weekend, that he finds the time to occasionally spend moments of his week with them, doing something to create a memory, to encourage and continue that bond that they have with him.
This is what I pray for.

Title: Sunday
Content:
As I sit here right now typing at my dining room table, a friend is sitting on the other end working on their own laptop, with Katherine hanging over looking at the screen pointing out pictures that are coming up on the screen.Â  Katherine has become a strong book-a-holic, begging for books to be read to her, or for her to go through and point out animals, colors, and items to you herself.Â  She LOVES reading, itâ€™s so incredibly precious.Â  I was reading at 2 1/2yo, I wonder when reading for her will click.Â  For Jonah, he staggered through reading, finally having it click for him when he was in second grade.Â  Alyssa is entering first, and hasnâ€™t quite picked up reading yet.Â  Iâ€™m sure she too will be in reading help, as Jonah was.Â  Katherine thoughâ€¦. with her love for books being overflowing, I doubt that itâ€™ll be another five years before sheâ€™s reading.Â  I have no doubt that in another year, by the time sheâ€™s turning 3yo, sheâ€™ll be reading.Â  I love watching my kids, and observing the passions in life they hold, and watching how they transpire ğŸ™‚
The biggest thing Katherine is learning right now, is her colors.Â  "Yellow bus, green car, blue truck, brown dog, orange book, purple ball".Â  Sheâ€™s learning her numbers, simple counting from 1 to 10.Â  Once she has that weâ€™ll work on counting backwards and simple addition and subtraction.Â  She almomst has it.Â  We count walking up and down the stairs.Â  I was taking notice at the similarities of Jonah and Katherine vs Alyssa.Â  Alyssa has the wonderful quality ofÂ make believeÂ role playing.Â  She is incredible with it, something that Jonah never did and something Iâ€™d like to encourage Katherine to do, although with a sister like Alyssa Iâ€™m not sure how sheâ€™ll get away not playing make believe ğŸ™‚Â  Alyssa also completely lets herself go dancing, sheâ€™s an incredible child.
Alyssa met a new friend today, a child who is also entering first grade who lives near right next door to us.Â  She met her today on our way out the door feeding horses.Â  I sat there watching the two of them interact, finally calling Alyssa over to the car.Â  I explained that we needed to go feed horses, but when we came back she could play.Â  She excitingly told the girl.Â  When we arrived back, I smiled as the sweet nextdoor child, said, "Hello there girl!!!".Â  They played from 1pm â€“ 6pm, dressup and tea party.Â  Alyssa was in heaven.Â  She came up at that time and asked if she could go swimming with them.Â  I went down to talk with the childs grandfather.Â  What a wonderful family.Â  The mother of this child is a single mom, sheâ€™ll be home on Tuesday, I look forward to meeting her.
While down there, the witch lady who has chewed my kids for playing with a volume level much lower then normal children, screamed from her balcony at the two girls.Â  She yelled at me, and it gave me the opportunity to face her back â€“ letting her know that if she had a problem with the kids she needed to talk to the office.Â  She threatened to call the police.Â  *Shrug* Thatâ€™s fine, what are they going to do?Â  6pm, the terrorizers are quietly playing tea party.Â  Ugh.Â  She yelled that they have been screaming all afternoon, and sheâ€™s already once told them to be quiet.Â  This is a lady who has no children.Â  She also came over to the pool a few weeks ago, yelling at both of my girls as well as a few other children who were part of the group, for being too loud.Â  Iâ€™ve already been in touch with management about it, only to also find out that sheâ€™s been harrassing the neighbor that lives below her, also threatening to call the cops.
I learned more about her tonight.Â  She is an author, co-authoring a few books with a good friend of hers who lives below her, who also has yelled at the kids but has also shown a very sweet and kind side to her.Â  I decided that the best solution would be to sit down with her, with the other parents here, and come to a compromise.Â  As even the office said, the kids canâ€™t be kept locked inside, itâ€™s summer time and need the freedom to play.Â  Obviously, any kid noise at all bothers her.Â  Kids need to play, while at the same time she needs her peace too.Â  My hope is that we can agree that the kids can freely play until 6pm at a respectful kid volume.Â  If she is having a day where she needs quiet, then she can call me and Iâ€™ll pull the kids inside or weâ€™ll go elsewhere.Â  I can understand someone needing quiet.Â  She said there were four other people that are upsetâ€¦.. I would like to find out who these people are and talk with them also.Â  Was she just white lying?Â  Itâ€™s very important to me that everyone and their comfort is respected, while my kids are also able to be kids.
I suppose Iâ€™m fighting more for this now since Alyssa has a friend who I am sure sheâ€™ll be playing much more with, and will be in that back area behind my building.Â  They live on ground level and here on the corner.Â  I want to be sure we catch this now so the kids can freely play.Â  When she yelled at the kids, Alyssa ran inside crying, coming out with coaxing while she asked, "Is the scary lady gone?".Â  I donâ€™t want that to happen again.Â  While at the same time, I donâ€™t want to continue to keep my kids locked inside with concern that their talking will bother this lady.Â  I do all I can to respect all around.Â  If my kids are throwing a tantrum, are loud, or fighting, I shut the windows and doors.Â  Iâ€™m not going to have it bother others.Â  I was told today by this family, they didnâ€™t even realize kids lived here, theyâ€™re so quiet.Â  I do my best.Â  I hope that a comfortable compromise can be made.Â  I will be talking to the management tomorrow though, to let them know what happened and what we are doing to solve the problem.Â  What I worry about, is that although they may have lived here for a while, the property is now under new ownership and management.Â  The complaints the office has received is all they know about these two ladies.Â  Iâ€™d rather we come to a peaceful agreement before either are considered for eviction for yelling at tenents children and harrassing the parents.Â  I most certainly am glad that I am not the only one.
I canâ€™t wait to pick up Jonah.Â  Six more days!Â  I miss him SO MUCH!Â  Itâ€™s been almost seven weeks.Â  This is the longest heâ€™s spent with his dad.Â  I am happy for him ğŸ™‚Â  He isnâ€™t ready to talk to his dad about his desire to homeschool yet, he knows that he strongly disagrees with it.Â  He agrees with my decision of talking to him in December, when Jonah sees his dad again.Â  He will have had four months of homeschooling at that time, as well as one or two testings having occured.Â  I plan to bring with me all the work heâ€™s accomplished, his schedule, as well as his scores for last year vs this year â€“ â€“ â€“ â€“ showing to him the incredible progress he has made.Â  I have no doubt this will occur.Â  Jonah still dreads his dad seeing his scores from last year, basically he failed 3rd gra
de.Â  He feels horrible, and doesnâ€™t want to appear as a failure in his dads eyes.Â  Poor guy ğŸ™Â  But, it will be important for his dad to see the direction Jonah was heading in, and what homeschool has provided for him.Â  I feel so strongly about this, that should his dad argue with me, I will fight him.Â  Something I normally wouldnâ€™t do, but not when I see the incredible negative results that were occuring.Â  Should Jonah not flourish in the homeschool program, then I wouldnâ€™t hesitate placing him back into the public school system, but based on his personality and the way he learns best, I have no doubt that he will progress very well and VERY quickly.Â  Iâ€™m excited to start with him.
These two pictures were taken by a friends phone.Â  The first one is Alyssa on her pony, myself, and Katherine in my arms.Â  Alyssa was so proud to show off her pony, Sierra.Â  Sierra foundered last year so has been on the recovery.Â  Sheâ€™s MUCH better, and almost ready to be ridden regularly again.Â  I love having Sierra in our family, sheâ€™s been with us for 8 1/2 years now.Â  She one day will pass onto Katherine, but for now sheâ€™s Alyssaâ€™s pony.Â  I have no doubt that sheâ€™ll one day be teaching my own grandchildren to ride ğŸ™‚Â  Doesnâ€™t Alyssa look beautiful up there???

This next picture was the one taken yesterday at the local grangeâ€™s, "Customer Appreciation Day".Â  Katherine was on one pony and then begged to ride the second too.Â  The saddle was crooked, but Katherine didnâ€™t notice.Â  I canâ€™t imagine my kids not being a part of horses in some sort of way.Â  I need to be sure to offer them more time to ride.Â  Jonah was close to entering his first horse show when he was Katherineâ€™s age.Â  I would LOVE for the kids to all have their own horses one day, but not sure about that.Â  We have two right now, Jonahâ€™s horse and Alyssaâ€™s pony.Â  Good enough â€“ spendy suckers are more costly then kids! LOL

Well, thatâ€™s about it.Â  I seem to be venturing to this diary to type much more often.Â  The entries are turning out LONG!Â  Sorry ğŸ™‚

â€¦..we were talking about all that was going on in our lives, he just got back from Japan, a girl he met and was drawn too, talked about a mutual friend and how great sheâ€™s doing, whatâ€™s happening in my life, and then commented that I had quite a bit going on between the kids, horses, and a few other things â€“ what would I like more of in my life at this point?Â  A partner.Â  An answer quickly given, and without doubt much desired.Â  Someone to curl up with and wake up next to, to pamper, love, give my support, and receive it too.Â  Maybe Iâ€™m dreaming, maybe that will never happen, but itâ€™s the one thing in my life Iâ€™m missing and I hope to find one day.Â  I learned a lot in my marriage, one being what a horrible wife I was â€“ something I easily admit to â€“ and what I can do differently if Iâ€™m lucky enough to ever find someone IÂ match wellÂ with, whoâ€™s willing to take on three kids (not easily found), as well as my life.Â  Someone where we both compliment eachother and bring out and shine the best in the other.

Title: â€¦.*sigh*â€¦.
Content:
Tonight I am frustrated â€“ not upset in any regards, more disappointed I suppose.Â  As school supplies were purchased for my daughter, I wished her father desired to beÂ a part of this big event for her.Â  I considered calling him tonight and inviting him to do something â€“ anything â€“ so the kids could enjoy his company, but I resisted.Â  He will call when heâ€™s ready.Â  The two months mark has been crossed now.Â  Itâ€™s sad.Â  Especially when Alyssa asks me about her dad and where he is.Â  Although the comments donâ€™t come too often, I know they cross her mind.Â  "Heâ€™s really busy honey, he loves you A LOT though".
Tomorrow she has school orientation, where sheâ€™ll be meeting her teacher.Â  Wednesday she starts her first day of school of FIRST GRADE!!! **mushy heart**.Â  She looked absolutely precious today, with her long black sports pants and a beautiful pink/white shirt that tied in the back.Â  She was down playing with her friend and ran back up to change clothes (from her snow white costume into the above clothes).Â  Quickly dipped her hair into water, brushed and braided it.Â  She takes my heart away.
I have to accept it though.Â  Everyone lives life differently, priorities are different (I surely know mine are vastly different then others).Â  It doesnâ€™t make them wrong, just different then your own.Â  All you can do is live life in the way that is right for you â€“ taking into consideration those that are directly effected.Â  I still couldnâ€™t imagine going so long without seeing my children â€“ but maybe thatâ€™s just me.Â  My children are my everything.Â  And I know that who I am as a parent to them, is a part of their success in life as a person, partner, and parent.Â  I may not always be perfect, but every day I do my very best.
TonightÂ Jonahâ€™s dad called.Â  He started talking about homeschooling and blew when I explained my main reason for doing so now.Â  Jonah asked me not to say anything, that he didnâ€™t want to appear as a failure in his dads eyes.Â  I thought it would be ok â€“ I was wrong ğŸ™Â  Jonah got on the phone (I prewarned him what I did) and faced his dad.Â  He held back his tears, and then after hanging up he wrapped his arms around my waist, buried his head into me and just cried.
His dad felt lied to, when nothing was just ever said.Â  It has to be so hard forÂ a child to want to tell his dad something but be unable to because he knows what will result from it.Â  To censor himself.Â  I always hope my children feel as though they can come and tell me anything â€“ anything at all.Â  So far Iâ€™m doing pretty well in that department.Â  His dad wanted to know why he was never told â€“ that was why â€“ that reaction.Â  He didnâ€™t see that as a reason.Â  Jonah seems very cautious what information he offers to his dad.
Jonah and I sat and talked.Â  Again I reminded him how much is dad loves him and just wants what he feels is best.Â  Jonah said he just wants to make his dad happy.Â  This is what our main talk was over.Â  You canâ€™t live life to make another person happyÂ (maybe the better term would be to not live your life in fear of disappointing someone, or to gain or keep someones approval), otherwise youâ€™ll end up having a very poor and unhappy life.Â  You canâ€™t ever make everyone happy, and living for one person is a miserable way to be.Â  I reminded him of Juliane, and how I jumped through hoops for years to keep her happy, facing constant disapproval,Â and where was she now?Â  Not talking to me.Â  I reminded him of his dad, and how he bent over backwards to please his father, but never got anywhere.Â  All he wanted was his dads complete approval and praise, and rarely ever got it.Â  Every day he worked to please his dad â€“ Jonahâ€™s dad still feels like a failure, and his dad died feeling so.Â  
With reminding Jonah of these events, I reinstated how important it was for him to live for himself.Â  No one ever is going to always agree with him, and not everyone will.Â  I reminded that even with me, I wasnâ€™t going to push him one way or another on anything, but would like a solid reason as to why he wanted to do somethingâ€¦. and not for the reason of someones approval.
Basically, be an independant thinker.Â  Believe in your thoughts and reasons.
He called his dad again, to say he loved him, and bursted out bawling ğŸ™Â  Telling his dad how much he loved him and how sorry his was for letting him down *I could have cried*.Â  I was proud of him though â€“ although he tried to be careful what and how he said something to his dad, he also stood his ground.Â  What an amazing child.Â  
His dad began ranting how I took him (Jonah) away from him, and how he wants to be a father to him, and canâ€™t so far away.Â  He wants to spend more time with him but canâ€™t.Â  Jonah excitedly told him how with homeschooling now, so long as he can meet me half way (where we usually meet â€“ near 250mi for both of us) he can come down almost anytime so long as his schoolwork is completed.Â  An open door to solve the situation, and his dad stalls and â€˜reminds Jonahâ€™ that he has a restaurant to run and wont always be able to have himÂ *sigh*.Â  He definitely is a hard worker.
Whatâ€™s unfortunate for both of these fathers, although very different, is that they ARE roll models in their childrens lives, whether they realize it or not.Â  Both in how they act and how they treat situations.Â  Jonah looks up to his dad, Alyssa looks up to hers â€“ while wondering where he is.Â  I do what I can to provide strong male role models in their life, but nothing will replace their own fathers.Â  
When talking to one guy friend, he told me about his girlfriend and her insecurities of not being good enough orÂ the manÂ sheâ€™s with staying around.Â  I asked if this stemmed from childhood, and he said yes.Â  Her parents seperated when she was young and her father was never around.
I can understand where both fathers are coming from, but what about the kids?
But I keep these thoughts to myself, wish both men strength as they do what they feel is best for their children, and always remind the kids how much their father loves them â€“ â€“ â€“ which is very true.

Title: Frappachino Fairy

Quickly here I need toÂ call MIL and get her address again.Â  I would love for the kids to be able to send pictures and letters to her, I donâ€™t want her to feel like a forgotten grandmother.Â  I was lucky to be able to catch a visit/breakfast with her, a huge reason as to why I drove Jonah down to his dads a few months ago.Â  Sheâ€™s not going to live forever, isnâ€™t in the best of health, and donâ€™t want to regret not taking the time.
Time.Â  Time is so simple.
I know all happens for a reason, I do believe this.Â  It doesnâ€™t always take away the feeling of loss and pain though.Â  My grandmother meant a lot to me.Â  I regret not spending more time with her, not taking just a few simple hours of the day to go and spend time with her.Â  Two weeks before I was going to drive down to visit with her and have generation photos taken, something to hang on my wall (I could feel the end coming), I received the call.Â  I knew what it was before I picked up the phone.Â  My grandmother had died in her sleep.Â  I sobbed, the only one since when my best friend died eight years ago.Â  I still miss her horribly.
One of the special things, is that Alyssa holds her birthdate.Â  I love that, I always have.
Donâ€™t live life as if tomorrow will come.Â  That there will always be time to mend a friendship, to visit with someone, or to embrase that particular person again.Â  You may never have that chance.Â  Embrase all you can today.
Back to the Frappachino Fairy.Â  Thank you.Â  For being there back five years ago when I first met you, back when I fell apart, being there nowâ€¦â€¦ and being a part of what will be in the future ğŸ™‚

Content:

When he left the room, I talked with his teacher about my concerns and how he was left feeling last year, and how important it is to me that his slipping is caught early so he doesnâ€™t end up in the hole again.Â  I also talked with her about how his dad is going to want to be in touch with her, and how he certainly loves Jonah and wants whatâ€™s best for him, but as I explained how his dad reacts when Jonah isnâ€™t doing well, she said she will be careful.
I LOVE THIS TEACHER!

Â 
Â

Anyway, I was browsing through their online site a bit more tonight, and saw that I can upload the photos I would like to print, and walk over and pick them up.Â  HOW NICE IS THAT????Â  I have heart wal-mart does that too, but this is a store right next door to me.Â  Iâ€™m going to have fun with that!!Â  19 cents a piece ğŸ˜€

I was over at a friends house a few days ago and saw them burning a candle in their fireplace.Â  It was so peaceful looking walking up to the door, as well as inside.Â  My fireplace has sat unused since I moved inâ€¦. what a wonderful idea to do with it!Â  I placed two of my candles into the fireplace, and for the last two nights have enjoyed the quiet flicker of the flames.Â  Itâ€™s so beautiful and relaxing.

There is a little girl I watched for a few hours six months ago, who is the same age as Katherine, my daughter.Â Â Aubrey never really warmed up, but considered it towards the end when her parents picked her up.Â  Her dad stopped by my house night before last and asked if there was any way his daughter could come for a period of time the next morning.Â  Of course!Â  He showed up this morning and asked if she could stay for the day.Â  Tonight he asked what my weekly rates are, that she might need to start coming on a regular basis.Â

And the best thing I love, is Alyssa has not yet been even slightly late for school.Â  Always on time, always arriving just ahead of the first bells ring.Â  Jonah starts school on Monday (not earlier), and it will hold the same for him too â€“ â€“ it better ğŸ˜›
Tonight, against Katherineâ€™s desires, I stripped her down and we headed towards the bathroom.Â  She wasnâ€™t too keen on the idea, but slightly cooperative.Â  Alyssa crawled in too, as I finished up with Katherine, and then washed Alyssaâ€™s hair.Â  She climbed out, got dressed and headed into bed, while I tried to coax Katherine out of the tub.Â  I pulled the plug and waited.Â  Surely sheâ€™d want to get out after it emptied!!!Â  Instead she layed on her tummy slidding back and forth and squeeling with delight, LOLÂ  OMG she was SO CUTE!!!!

Content:
"Another fun filled day!"Â  
I think this is a line people use to try to ignore all the challenges that presented itself.Â  Actually, my day was pretty delightful â€“ minus the explosion of a diaper that left me wiping down a wiggling naked baby and dressing her in new clothes, LOLÂ Â I did have to settle quite the aruments between the two older kids today.Â  My goodness they can squabble!!

Content:
That is all it seems Iâ€™ve been doing last night and today, cleaning.Â  I threw up my hands in trying to keep the girls in their room at night, so am changing things around.Â  Jonah had my room, a nice big room, while the girls had the little room.Â  Last night I pulled EVERYTHING out of the girls room, got rid of the sleeping item that was in their, went through clothes and found homes for items outgrown and threw away the too worn ones.Â  I had gotten quite upset the day before at my son â€™cause I went into the room to find my trailer title since it was selling, and was NOT happy with how I could barely move, so the "gutting" was well needed.Â  What both kids know, is when it comes down to that *I* decide what stays and what goes, and they know not to even peek into the garbage sack, lol
Jonahâ€™s bed was taken apart and moved over into his new room, a comfortable double bed with water tubes.Â  All blankets hit the wash (3 washes), and I continued to go through boxes, containers, etc.Â  The book shelf was moved over to the new room, as well as a new black computer desk JC gave us (him) a while ago.Â  He couldnâ€™t be happier, and it looks pretty good!
Since I woke up this morning, Iâ€™ve been doing laundry.Â  Load after load after load.Â  I have washed every single blanket, sheets, clothing itemsâ€¦. itâ€™s been going non-stop for the last 14 hours.Â  Jonah laughed, saying his room smelled like flowers, lol.
I found a GREAT deal on a bunkbed for the girls, although picking it up tonight didnâ€™t pan out since the girl was unable to be reached.Â  Hopefully itâ€™ll happen tomorrow.Â  It has a completely railed sides for the top (I am so paranoid about one of my kids falling off) and the bottom folds out into a full size bed.Â  This will comfortably sleep my youngest (2yo) and myself.Â  
Itâ€™s been nice to go through EVERYTHING, every single clothing item, every single box, but OMFG I am so ready to be done already, but as it looks Iâ€™ll be continuing tomorrow.Â  Iâ€™m dragging myself, but Iâ€™m thrilled.
Itâ€™s been a while since Iâ€™ve written, there has been a tramendous amount going on.Â  I hit quite the emotional slump for about 1 1/2 weeks, facing things that kinds shocked me and felt a "pain" and desire I never expected (long story).Â  It took a while to come to terms with it, and understand what I was feeling.Â  I was also dealing with issues with the drill team, still am but in a different light.Â  Another area where a lot of hurt is felt and seem unable to get past it since it was a slap once again upon something already raw.Â  I do have a few private entries written about all that occured, I needed to write, but nothing I wanted to post.
I sold my truck last week and trailer this week, the funds going to pay off more bills.Â  Itâ€™s been nice.Â  I want to say there are a lot to take care of, but although thereâ€™s a few small ones, the main ones are quite large.Â  In time theyâ€™ll be taken care of.
I met up with a friend yesterday.Â  It never seems to amaze me how much time can go by where you dont see someone, and when you finally do itâ€™s as though they were never absent.Â  Maybe its because of the "thinking about you" every day that occurs, maybe thatâ€™s a natural way for staying in touch.Â  The mother to this baby, and I, are just the same.Â  Mooonths if not well over a year will pass without us seeing eachother, but when the time finally comes where we do itâ€™s as though we saw eachother just last week.Â  Same goes for my surrogate daughters parents.Â  I enjoy friends like these, we all have lives and are all busy ğŸ™‚

Title: Appauling
Content:
It is shocking to me, the severe lack of respect, consideration, and thought some have for others.Â  At some point you give up, donâ€™t you?Â  It has been quite some time since I have felt this bitter towards anyone, this crushed, to feel hurt this deep.Â  And it isnâ€™t the action taken, it is the enormous lack of consideration and care before taking that action when knowing full well the feelings another would feel, and just-not-care.Â  The "I got what I wanted" attitude with a smile, especially when it happens far more often then not.Â  I am certainly not cut out for turning a cold shoulder and â€˜dealing with it anywayâ€™.Â  Definitely not a quality I have.

I have lost the heart, the drive, and the desire.Â  This was the breaking point when things were so very raw as it was.Â  Sad and disappointing.
Scary to feel this hurt to the point of such anger towards someone.Â  Anger is not good.
Such is life.Â  Oh well.Â  Life goes on and new dreams are developed, I have learned.Â  This in itself is not a bad thing.Â  Old paths are ended and new directions are formed, arenâ€™t they?Â  Of course they are.Â  Or am I just trying to come up with an excuse and feel betterâ€¦.. *big sigh*

Content:

Spirit, my sweet and precious blind 2yo princess of a horse, became officially mine when I was finally able to adopt her from the program she was owned by, on September 11th.Â  That day has a few different meanings to me, and with that the perfect day for such an occurance.Â  Sheâ€™s been under my care and training since she was 6mo.Â  I have always loved her very very much.Â  She has a very long life ahead of us, and I look forward to it.Â  Hopefully this next year Iâ€™ll be able to take her to the coast and have pictures taken.

Surrogacy â€“ Cassidy is now 4 1/2mo!!Â  Time is flying by, and the pictures Iâ€™m receiving are the dearest of dearests.Â  Last week I finally received the picture I was hoping her mom would eventually send, a picture of the two of them together.Â  I wanted to reach through the computer and hug her when I received it (she hates cameras, but took it just for me) â€“ see, she has a blood disorder that leaves her chance of dying quite large.Â  My mom asked me a question after Cassidy had left for home, the only time I cried about the situation, "What if she died tomorrow".Â  I hope I never loose her, not until sheâ€™s an old lady, has seen Cassidy through high school, married, and children of her own.Â  But if she did die tomorrow, she will have died with one of the most improtant dreams of hers granted.Â  She is no longer longing, her heart is no longer aching.Â  She holds her daughter in her arms, a piece of my heart.Â  And Cassidy?Â  She is the most beautiful little girl in the world ğŸ˜€Â  I will be seeing her in November, and then going up for Christmas.Â  I canâ€™t wait!
â€¦.. and on the other side.Â  Weâ€™re working on a sibling for Mimi.Â  Mimi is my near 5yo surro-daughter.Â  She recently came to understand that she grew in my tummy, it was adorable when she explained it.Â  Itâ€™s neat to see how, through time, things are coming together.Â  When explinations are given, when questions come up.Â  Our first cycle failed, we are hoping the second one works.Â  If not, we continue on each month and will turn to a clinic for help eventually.Â  The cards are stacked against us this time, with a low count and motility, but we are trying anyway.
Money â€“ I took a hard drop in income this last week, but itâ€™s actually worked out well (after I finished gulping and worrying).Â  Starbucks and Subway have been my most difficult enjoyments to cut out, but with the cut in income, Iâ€™m learning to make all meals from scratch and am having a lot of fun with it.Â  I bought $100 worth of basics (canned, noodles, sauces, etc) from the $1 store and the rest of what I needed from the regular store.Â  Itâ€™s been a week now and I think Iâ€™ve only spent around $40 at the regular store for things such as milk and vegetables.Â  I did pick up powdered milk today, which many of the recipes seem to be calling for.Â  Yesterday the kids were thrilled when I handmade (everything) tortorlinis.Â  Tonight I made my first loaf of bread since I was a kid (the kids were so excited!), and for dessert tonight I made what is equivalent to Frostyâ€™s from Wendyâ€™s â€“ the kids about died, raving reviews I received!Â  I found the recipe to make ricotta cheese from scratch, so will be making that tomorrow â€“ as well as raviolis.Â  Giving my hand at making yogurt too.Â  Basically itâ€™s anything I can make thatâ€™s full of flavor, the kids love, that only involved the basics to cook.Â  Itâ€™s pretty impressive how much of it all I have in my cupboards.Â  Whatâ€™s even more impressive, is how much money Iâ€™m saving (gobloads) and how thrilled the kids have been with their mealsâ€¦ and how nutritious theyâ€™ve been!
Â Divorce â€“ Well, the girls dad finally called and asked to fileâ€¦ itâ€™s well past time, but Iâ€™m glad we waited.Â  Itâ€™s been near 2 1/2 years since we seperated, and really, how we wanted everything set up is quite different now then it was then.Â  Weâ€™re also able to talk like normal human beings, discuss issues, questions, put together a realistic parenting plan without seething frustration from either of us.Â  Weâ€™re able to express what eachother needs, as well as the kids, itâ€™s nice.Â  The original papers were filed Sept. 27thâ€¦. weâ€™ll be sending the final papers in sometime around the 1st of the year.Â  Although things have been ended now for quite a while, itâ€™s strange as itâ€™s officially ending.Â  Iâ€™ve learned a tramendous amount over these last few years, as well as what I could have done in the marriage.Â  I do have moments of sadness, which I didnâ€™t expect.Â  I think, hope, weâ€™ll always be friends in some sort of capacity though.Â  Heâ€™s a great guy.
Well, I think thatâ€™s just about it.Â  A few other things, but itâ€™s late.Â  Iâ€™ll mention them later.

Well I keep trying to type an entry and continue to be distracted and have to stop.Â  So, now that I am barely able to keep my eyes open Iâ€™m going to try to type out a quick entry.Â  Ha â€“ quick entries for me still seem to turn out like books!
Â 
Things have been going well â€“ well, you know, in between the craziness, confusions, the "what the hell is going on???", and all the other fun stuff of day to day life of a single mom with a handful of children, three ofÂ my own and what seems to be the rest of the neighborhood.Â  This weekend I had a little boy stay over, a child whoâ€™s become my sons best friend.Â  This is the second weekend heâ€™s slept over both Fri and Sat night.Â  We have an issue with food with him, complete Mr. Picky!!Â  Yesterday I had it, and after stewing all day I had a discussion with him.Â  Pickiness is not allowed here anymore, and after a "thank you bite", if he doesnâ€™t like whatâ€™s been made to eat he can go home to eat.Â  He only lives a few buildings over.

Cassidy, my beautiful (surrogate) daughter just turned 5mo.Â  What a gorgeous little girl!!!Â  Itâ€™s been wonderful to continue to receive the pictures that I do, and my close friendship with her mother continues to remain strong.Â  Some point here Iâ€™ll have to post a new picture of her ğŸ™‚

Well, this month isnâ€™t looking too hopeful at all for conceiving a sibling for my 1st surro-daughter, Mimi,Â (now almost 5yo).Â  Last month failed, and this month sure looks like itâ€™s going to.Â  Iâ€™m waiting on AF to show up, it feels as though itâ€™s right around the corner.Â  The parents are going to be checking into using a clinic and go through IUIâ€™s again.Â  Mimi was conceived this way, itâ€™s quite easy.Â  I knew going into this that the cards were well stacked against me.Â  The father went through chemo 4 years ago, and although his sperm went from nothing back up to something, I am working with a low count and low motility.Â  The chances of conception are very slim.Â  I am still hoping, I feel it will work eventuallyâ€¦..

And the most interesting eventâ€¦. my van is going out.Â  Something about the engine, and as I pulled in tonight I know itâ€™s going to need to now just sit.Â  Iâ€™m not sure what to do yet, but Iâ€™m hunting out for a bike.Â  Yes, I know weâ€™re going into winter, but itâ€™s a decent form of transportation.Â  The nice thing is that I live close to everything I need, from the stores as well as the horses.Â  I have been talking about picking up excersising in attempt to loose weight and create a healthier body, guess Iâ€™m just being pushed into it now ğŸ™‚
Â 
So many more thoughts and such, but might as well end it here.Â  Iâ€™ll try to type at a later time.

â€¦â€¦ and here it is the next night, 11:47pm.Â

This December 5th, my first surrogate daughter turned 5yo.Â  She has grown to be one of the most beautiful children I know, so bright and strong.Â  Her dad wasÂ found to have cancer when she was 4mo, and went through chemo and well as two surgeries.Â  They wanted another child, but lost their ability.Â  In April I received a call that he had a minimal count but there was something!!!Â  We started cycling in August.Â  It failed.Â  September failed.Â  Octobers timing was completely off because the father was traveling on business, it was a shock when I saw that second line on the pregnancy test.Â  I had tears of happiness as well as relief.Â  As I step into the new 2008 year, Iâ€™m 10 weeks pregnant with a baby sister or brother for my surro-princess, she is going to be soooo excited when she finds out.Â  Only recently did she learn that she grew in my tummy, her questions were adorable to answer.Â  My first midwife appointment is this Thursday.Â  What a blessing, we were given such low odds, we chose to try anyway, and we were successful.Â  I am still in shock and just amazing.

In 2015 I met someone.Â  Someone who I thought Iâ€™d be staying with.Â  I was so young and naive in mind.Â  Although he never raised a hand to me, in ways I feel it would have been less painful if he had done so, the psychological, emotional, and mental abuse sliced me soul deep.Â  Looking back now I can see how strong I was, and how beautifully I danced the journey.Â  I am still breathing on this side, I made it.Â  I gained many life lessons in that journey, power packed in to seven years, a bonus daughter, and a child.
